comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pierre_Roques "Pierre Auguste Roques (28 December 1856 – 26 February 1920) was a French general and creator of the French air force." "At the outbreak of World War I, he was the commanding general of the 12th Corps. By January 1915 he had become the commander of the First Army, and then became the Minister of War from January to December 1916, following Gallieni and preceding Lyautey. Subsequently, he served briefly as the commander of the Fourth Army and then as the Inspector General of Works and Organization for the French Army until February 1919."
